Summary Multilingual business executive of IT and software industries with over 18 years of experience in strategic planning, business development, sales, marketing, product management, services and operation. Extensive expertise and practice in China with significant achievements.  
 
As a Certified International Trade Professional, Raymond brings vital opportunities to occidental entrepreneurs in such a global economic turmoil by introducing their enterprises into China and penetrating this largest emerging market. Raymond held several International Business Consulting positions in government and private organizations after he migrated to Canada in 2006.  
 
Before that, Raymond was Senior Manager of International Business in HP Global Delivery China Centre, the second largest delivery force of HP with over 2000 engineers. He developed US market and won the first US end user contract from the world’s largest automaker.  
 
When he was Senior Manager, Services Division of Dell Asia Pacific, he was responsible for Services P&L in Great China. He led the team to innovate and launch a high-margin product in China successfully; he improved customer satisfaction and purchase rate significantly through process redesigning, sales training, incentive and Integrated Marketing Communication programs. These efforts ensured Dell was awarded "China IT Services Award 2003" from Computer World Magazine.  
 
Earlier in his career, Raymond grew from a sales pioneer of IBM Software to a regional sales and marketing manager in China. Raymond recruited the first IBM national software distributor in China. He also introduced Tivoli brand into China and built its China business from scratch.  
 
Raymond intensified his leadership, sales, services, and people management skills theoretically and practically when he was a consultant of Wilson learning, a leading global Human Performance Improvement consulting firm. Specialties:• Strong research, analysis, planning, budgeting, consulting and people management skills.  
• Comprehensive Sales and Integrated Marketing Communication practice.  
• Life cycle product and brand management in Asian countries.  
• Leader with entrepreneurial spirits, creative thinker and problem solver.
